channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump threatens military action in Minneapolis. And, inside his healthcare plan
item.description: President Trump threatens to invoke the Insurrection Act in Minnesota to stop protests happening in Minneapolis. And, the president unveils what he calls a new healthcare plan.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump threatens to invoke the Insurrection Act in Minnesota to stop protests happening in Minneapolis. And, the president unveils what he calls a new healthcare plan.

(Image credit: Octavio Jones)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: This hospice has a bold new mission: saving lives
item.description: A hospice in Uganda asked itself: Can we do more than ease the pain of dying? Can we actually prevent deaths from cervical and breast cancer?
item.content:encoded:
A hospice in Uganda asked itself: Can we do more than ease the pain of dying? Can we actually prevent deaths from cervical and breast cancer?

(Image credit: Brian Simpson for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Joanne Cavanaugh Simpson

item.title: Canada agrees to cut tariff on Chinese EVs in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products
item.description: Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.

(Image credit: Sean Kilpatrick)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What do eggs, Grok and Greenland have in common? They're all quiz-worthy! Are you?
item.description: See if you can get a perfect score for once.
item.content:encoded:
See if you can get a perfect score for once.

(Image credit: Robyn Beck/AFP via Getty Images; Michael Loccisano/Getty Images; Frazer Harrison/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Minnesota shows what happens when governing and content creation merge
item.description: As President Trump approaches one year back in office, the policies his administration pursues — and how those policies are communicated — have been increasingly shaped by social media.
item.content:encoded:
As President Trump approaches one year back in office, the policies his administration pursues — and how those policies are communicated — have been increasingly shaped by social media.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: FEMA is getting rid of thousands of workers in areas recovering from disasters
item.description: Thousands of employees whose contracts end this year will lose their jobs, FEMA managers said at personnel meetings this week. The cuts could hobble the nation's disaster agency.
item.content:encoded:
Thousands of employees whose contracts end this year will lose their jobs, FEMA managers said at personnel meetings this week. The cuts could hobble the nation's disaster agency.

(Image credit: Jae C. Hong)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Hersher

item.title: House Republicans are investigating Jan. 6. NPR fact-checked the first hearing
item.description: A Republican-led congressional subcommittee is leading a new investigation into the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol. Do their claims add up?
item.content:encoded:
A Republican-led congressional subcommittee is leading a new investigation into the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol. Do their claims add up?

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach

item.title: With limited political power, Minnesota Democrats navigate resistance to Trump
item.description: From public pleas to lawsuits, Minnesota's Democratic leaders are trying to stop the surge of federal agents on their streets.
item.content:encoded:
From public pleas to lawsuits, Minnesota's Democratic leaders are trying to stop the surge of federal agents on their streets.

(Image credit: Ben Hovland/MPR)
item.dc:creator: Clay Masters

item.title: Political science professor talks about María Corina Machado's meeting with Trump
item.description: NPR's A Martinez talks to Eduardo Gamarra, a politics and international relations professor at Florida International University, about María Corina Machado's meeting with President Trump.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez talks to Eduardo Gamarra, a politics and international relations professor at Florida International University, about María Corina Machado's meeting with President Trump.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Woman remembers the age-defying love she shared with her husband
item.description: A woman who was married to a man twice her age remembers their relationship, and the important question she asked him when they spoke to StoryCorps 20 years ago.
item.content:encoded: A woman who was married to a man twice her age remembers their relationship, and the important question she asked him when they spoke to StoryCorps 20 years ago.
item.dc:creator: Jey Born
